fields.description: The natural groundwater recharge is relatively high in this area

The natural groundwater recharge is low in this area, meaning that groundwater stores are replenished slowly. This risk can be mitigated by including managed aquifer recharge or other groundwater recharge measures in the project.
Groundwater abstraction is lower than the natural recharge rate. This means that the current groundwater use is sustainable.

Groundwater use is higher than the rate of recharge in this area, which means groundwater availability is decreasing. 
This risk can be mitigated by including managed aquifer recharge or other groundwater recharge measures in the project
Population growth and the corresponding increase in pressure on groundwater resources is relatively low.
Population is expected to grow rapidly in this area, substantially increasing pressure on groundwater resources in the near future.
The area is not in close proximity to a wetland ecosystem. Negative impacts of groundwater abstraction on wetland ecosystems is not expected, but cannot be ruled out without a quantitative analysis.

The area is close to a wetland ecosystem that could be affected by groundwater abstraction. 
This risk can be mitigated by including managed aquifer recharge or other groundwater recharge measures in the project.
The physical characteristics of the area indicate that groundwater is not vulnerable to contamination. This means that pollutants at the surface are unlikely to reach the groundwater.

The physical characteristics of the area indicate that groundwater is vulnerable to pollution. This means that pollutants at the surface have a high chance of reaching and contaminating the groundwater.

Water reuse in the region is low, which indicates that surface water quality is likely good. Surface water that infiltrates into the subsurface is therefore unlikely to have a negative impact on groundwater quality.

Water reuse in the region is high, indicating that the region relies on water treatment and/or natural water quality buffers to maintain water quality. In the absence of these, contaminants in surface water may infiltrate and reach the groundwater. 
This risk can be mitigated by installing (waste)water treatment facilities in upstream areas.
Saline groundwater due to marine influences is not likely in this area based on the distance from the coast.
The area is close to the coast, which increases the likelihood of saline groundwater. Groundwater may not be suitable for its intended use without treatment.
Groundwater is likely to be saline in this area, and may not be suitable for its intended use without treatment.
Groundwater at this location is not expected to be saline.
Elevated fluoride concentrations in groundwater are not expected.
There is a risk of elevated fluoride concentrations in the groundwater in this area. Groundwater may not be suitable for its intended use without treatment.
Elevated arsenic concentrations in groundwater are not expected.
There is a risk of elevated arsenic concentrations in the groundwater in this area. Groundwater may not be suitable for its intended use without treatment.
